intro: Paronychia euboea, commonly known as the Euboean sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found in parts of Greece, Turkey, and the Balkans. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
